title: Basics of Corporate Finance
headline: Enhance your knowledge in corporate finance to make better financial decisions with this free online course.
description: Knowledge of corporate finance is necessary for planning a company's finances, raising capital, investment planning, risk management and financial assessment. This course will equip you with an instinctual understanding of financial principles and enable you to understand the market in which your company operates, create and assess value, compute and analyse financial statements and communicate business decisions to stakeholders.

courseDescription:
The main aim of corporate finance is to maximise the value of an organisation through the planning and execution of resources while evaluating risk and profitability. The purpose of corporate finance is also to maximise shareholder value. It is the job of corporate finance professionals to optimise the company’s capital structure by lowering its weighted average cost of capital as much as possible because a company's capital structure is important in amplifying the value of the business. You will learn how to ensure that your company has a sufficient supply of capital for its operations. Financial planning is a long-term method of handling finances to achieve goals. You will learn how to evaluate all aspects of your company’s financial life and determine your organisation’s financial target and the priorities of the stakeholders.

Financial risk management entails evaluating an organisation’s financial risks and designing strategic plans aligned with organisational goals and policy. You will learn how to deal with the risks that arise due to the financial market and how risks can be addressed and minimised in a business operation. The course will also teach you investment planning, objectives and principles of investing and how to build your investment portfolio. In addition, you will learn what a career path in corporate finance offers, qualifications and skills for corporate finance with a wide range of benefits of pursuing a career path in corporate finance professional service. Google Analytics is an important free tool you need to use as a financial advisor. You will learn how to use Google Analytics to understand your website users' behaviour, your websites' performance, check if your marketing campaigns are functional, and the most important metrics for financial advisors.

This course is divided into two learning modules. It is self-explanatory with summative questions at the end of each topic to test your knowledge and understanding of the topics covered in each module. By the end of this course, you would have accumulated a wealth of knowledge about corporate finance and if you are considering choosing corporate finance as a career path, you would have gained an understanding of what is expected of you as a finance manager, which will inherently position you to make the best financial decisions beneficial to your organisation and the relevant stakeholders.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Corporate Finance, Financial Planning and Analysis
modules.description: Corporate finance deals with capital structure, sources of funding, investment decisions of a corporation. In this module, you will learn about the activities that govern corporate finance, financial planning, and growth, financial planning process, financial analysis,formula for calculating cash flow, and how to compute your cash flow forecasts.
topics: Corporate Finance, Financial Planning and Analysis - Learning Outcomes
Corporate Finance, Financial Planning and Analysis - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Financial Risk Management, Investment Planning and Advisory
modules.description: Financial risk management deals with the use of financial instruments to manage a company's exposure to risk. In this module, you will learn about the different types of financial risks, framework for risks management, the benefits of managing financial risks, investment planning, investment objectives, and how to create your investment portfolio.
topics: Financial Risk Management, Investment Planning - Learning Outcomes
Financial Risk Management, Investment Planning - Lesson Summary

•  Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Define corporate finance.
    • List the important activities that govern corporate finance.
    • Discuss the importance of a financial manager.
    • Define and outline the objectives of financial planning.
    • Evaluate the importance of financial planning.
    • Explain the financial planning process.
    • Outline the financial planning areas of specialization.
    • Identify and explain the financial planning model.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Corporate finance deals with the capital structure of a corporation, including its funding and the actions that management takes to increase the value of the company.
    • The ultimate purpose of corporate finance is to maximize the value of a business through planning and implementation of resources while balancing risk and profitability.
    • Corporate finance activities include capital investments, capital financing, dividends, and return of capital. 
    • The primary role of the manager is to ensure that his company has a sufficient supply of capital.
    • A company's capital structure is crucial to maximizing the value of the business.
    • The ratio between a firm's liability and its equity is often the basis for determining how well balanced or risky the company's capital financing is.
    • Financial planning can help you evaluate all aspects of your financial life.
    • There are eight domains included in the financial planning process.
    • Methods for assisting clients in achieving their financial targets can be extended to the entire spectrum of clients' goals systematically by financial advisors. 
    • Financial advisors often specialize in one or two fields on which they focus their efforts.
    • Financial planning professionals should provide appropriate disclosures and expect to be bound by ethical principles.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Define risk and recognize how financial risks arise.
    • Identify major types of risks.
    • Discuss reasons for managing financial risk.
    • Outline the framework for risk management.
    • Identify the basic investment objectives.
    • Recognize how to build your investment portfolio.
    • State the basic principles of investing.
    • List and explain the different investment options.
    • Discuss the features of Google Analytics and how it works.

  • Financial Risk Management and Assessment

  • Lesson Summary

    • Many companies are affected by financial market exposure either directly or indirectly. 
    • Financial risk management is a process for dealing with the risks that arise due to financial markets.
    • Financial risk management is an ongoing operation. As the market and requirements evolve, strategies must be implemented and improved.
    • Risk identification's aim is to use staff's expertise to identify and describe all the potential financial risks to which the organization may be exposed.
    • The core elements of financial risk management include risk identification and assessment, development of a risk response implementation of a risk control strategy, etc.
    • Most investors want to earn the maximum amount on their investments as they will relative to the extent of risk they will assume.
    • If you wish to control your finances, you must prioritize your expenses and consider your debt. 
    • Diversification can occur across all asset classes, within asset classes, and over time.
    • If you are a long-time trader, volatility allows you to buy great stocks at a discount while others are panicking.
    • Google Analytics is a free tracking service provided by Google that tells you how people interact with your website.
    • New vs Returning Users, Bounce Rate, Responsive website are the most critical metrics for financial advisors.
